content.new:
Hey guys,

We are trying to submit a new robot which has an rgbd camera on the end on a pan tilt gimbal but I have run into a problem. FYI, I have been working exclusively with the model.sdf file up till now. So the joints and links appear to be setup properly in the SDF file \(see attached file - I have only set up the pan linkage for now, tilt will be added once I get this figured out\), but now I am unsure of how to subscribe or publish to the joint states. All tutorials/resources like the joint\_state\_publisher need an URDF rather than an SDF. So my questions are as follows, and if anyone has any insight or resources I can take a look at that would be very helpful so thank you in advance!

* Would it work just to create/edit a URDF to mirror my current SDF, then throw that into the joint\_state\_publisher, or will that not work because ignition is actually using our SDF model rather than the URDF?
* Is there another node or package I can configure to interface directly with the SDF joints?
* Is there a ros\_ign\_bridge for joints?

I’m new to making my own SDF’s and URDFs so apologies in advance.

‌
